result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 2:20 PM Defendant MICHAEL J THORSON appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with.  Defendant wishes to waive counsel in all these matters. Before Court will accept waiver, the defendant should appear in person in the courtroom.  Tagging along with 22CM285.
letter from defendant - wants to represent himself

No entry into any Class B licensed establishments. Maintain absolute sobriety. No travel outside the state without prior court approval.

11:28 AM Prosecuting attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant MICHAEL J THORSON in court, in custody. Victim rights have been complied with in the matters 21CM41, 21CF38, and 21CF35.  Defendant qualifies for public defender services, but no one appointed yet.  Defendant wishes to have his bond modified to qualify for trustee purposes.  Response by Atty. Parker.  Defendant is willing to waive time limits on the preliminary hearing.  Court makes its findings on the bond modification and sets a $10,000 signature bond.  Same conditions.  Court accepts waiver of time limits.  State was prepared to proceed.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
